member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Anchor
member.summary: Encapsulates an anchor to a specific location within the document.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Anchor.AlternateTextDescription
member.summary: Returns or sets the description of the alternative text for the picture or shape, for use by assistive technologies or applications which will not display the associated picture or shape.

remarks.p: WordprocessingML consumers which do not support the display of pictures or shapes may make use this property to describe the picture to the user. Screen reading applications or other assistive technologies may also make use of the property to describe the picture or shape to handicapped users.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Anchor.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which defines the anchor's horizontal alignment.

remarks.p: The HorizontalAlignment property is used in conjunction with the RelativeHorizontalPosition to define the horizontal aspect of the anchor's position. An anchor can be aligned with the left or right edge of the page, margin, paragraph, etc.

By default, the HorizontalAlignment property is not applicable, and positioning is implied to be absolute, defined by the value of the HorizontalOffset property. Explicitly setting the HorizontalAlignment property to a value other than 'None' overrides the HorizontalOffset property setting.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Anchor.HorizontalOffset
member.summary: Returns or sets the amount by which the anchor is offset horizontally from the boundary defined by the RelativeHorizontalPosition and HorizontalAlignment properties.

remarks.p: The RelativeHorizontalPosition and HorizontalAlignment properties define the boundary at which the anchor is positioned; the HorizontalOffset property defines an additional amount of space to be added by which to offset the position. For example, if an anchor is left-aligned with the margin, and the offset is set to 72 pts., the object will appear one inch from the left edge of the margin.
The unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property of the associated WordDocumentWriter.

When the HorizontalAlignment property is set to a value other than 'None', this property is not applicable. The HorizontalOffset property can be restored to its factory setting by assigning 'None' to this property, in which case the HorizontalAlignment property determines the horizontal positioning.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Anchor.RelativeHorizontalPosition
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which defines the part of the document to which the anchor's horizontal position is relative.

remarks.p: The RelativeHorizontalPosition property defines the area of the document to which the value of the HorizontalAlignment or HorizontalOffset property is relative. For example, if AnchorHorizontalAlignment is set to 'Left', and RelativeHorizontalPosition is set to 'LeftMarginArea', the anchor's left edge is aligned with the left edge of the document's left margin. If AnchorHorizontalAlignment is set to 'Right', and RelativeHorizontalPosition is set to 'Page', the anchor's right edge is aligned with the right edge of the page, overlapping with the area outside the margin.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Anchor.RelativeVerticalPosition
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which defines the part of the document to which the anchor's vertical position is relative.

remarks.p: The RelativeVerticalPosition property defines the area of the document to which the value of the VerticalAlignment or VerticalOffset property is relative. For example, if VerticalAlignment is set to 'Top', and RelativeVerticalPosition is set to 'Page', the anchor's top edge is aligned with the top edge of the page. If VerticalAlignment is set to 'Bottom', and RelativeVerticalPosition is set to 'Page', the anchor's bottom edge is aligned with the bottom edge of the page, overlapping with the area outside the margin.
When the VerticalAlignment property is explicitly set, the 'Paragraph' setting for this property is not supported; in that case this property resolves to 'Page'

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Anchor.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which defines the anchor's vertical alignment.

remarks.p: The VerticalAlignment property is used in conjunction with the RelativeVerticalPosition to define the vertical aspect of the anchor's position. An anchor can be aligned with the top or bottom edge of the page, margin, paragraph, etc.
By default, the VerticalAlignment property is not applicable, and positioning is implied to be absolute, defined by the value of the VerticalOffset property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Anchor.VerticalOffset
member.summary: Returns or sets the amount by which the anchor is offset from the boundary defined by the VerticalAlignment property.

remarks.p: The RelativeVerticalPosition and VerticalAlignment properties define the boundary at which the anchor is positioned; the VerticalOffset property defines an additional amount of space to be added by which to offset the position. For example, if an anchor is top-aligned with the margin, and the offset is set to 72 pts., the object will appear one inch down from the top edge of the margin.
The unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property of the associated WordDocumentWriter.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Anchor.Size
member.summary: Returns or sets the size at which the associated picture or shape is rendered.

remarks.p: In the absence of an explicit setting, this property returns null. In this case, pictures are displayed at their natural size, and shapes are displayed at a size of one inch square.
When set explicitly, the unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Anchor.SizeInTwips
member.summary: Returns the resolved size in TWIPs

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Anchor.SizeInEMUs
member.summary: Returns the resolved size in EMUs

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Anchor.TextWrapping
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the layout for text included in the same paragraph as the anchor.

remarks.p: The TextWrapping property works in conjunction with the TextWrappingSide property to define the manner in which text that is adjacent to the anchor is wrapped.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Anchor.TextWrappingSide
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the sides of the anchor around which adjacent text can be wrapped.

remarks.p: The TextWrappingSide property works in conjunction with the TextWrapping property to define the manner in which text that is adjacent to the anchor is wrapped.
The TextWrappingSide property is not applicable when the TextWrapping property is set to 'TextInBackground' or 'TextInForeground'.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Anchor.Hyperlink
member.summary: Returns a Hyperlink instance which provides a way to add a hyperlink to the picture.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlShape
member.summary: Abstract class which encapsulates a geometric shape such as a line, rectangle, ellipse, etc., which is rendered by the consumer using Vector Markup Language (VML).

remarks.p: Shapes are rendered by the consumer using Vector Markup Language (VML), which is supported in both MS Word 2007 and MS Word 2010.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlShape.Create(Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriter,Infragistics.Documents.Word.ShapeType)
member.summary: Creates a new VmlShape-derived instance based on the specified
member.param: The associated WordDocumentWriter.
A ShapeType constant which defines the type of shape to be created.

remarks.p: The type of the object returned from the Create method is different based on the specified . For example, when 'Line' is specified as the shape type, a VmlLine instance is returned.
To access properties that are specific to the VmlShape-derived type that is returned, the reference returned from this method can be upcasted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlShape.LineColor
member.summary: Returns or sets the color used to render the perimeter of the shape.

remarks.p: The LineColor property controls the color for a line shape.
The LineColor property controls the color of the outer border for shapes which have area. Use the FillColor property to change the color of the interior region.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlShape.LineWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets the width of the line which renders the perimeter of the shape.

remarks.p: When set explicitly, the unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlShape.LineStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets the style of the line drawn around the perimeter of the shape.

remarks.p: The LineStyle property controls the style for a line shape. By default, lines are drawn with a solid, unbroken stroke; the LineStyle property can be used to draw dashes, dots, or combinations thereof.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlShape.Type
member.summary: Returns a ShapeType constant which describes the type of the shape.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlShape.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties of this instance to their respective defaults.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlLine
member.summary: Renders a straight line using Vector Markup Language (VML)

remarks.p: The origin for a line is always implied to be the top-left corner of it bounding rectangle. When the bounding rectangle's height is non-zero, the slope of the line is negative (resembles a backslash); to make the slope positive, set the InvertY property to true.
To render a horizontal line, set the Height component of the Size property to zero.
To render a vertical line, set the Width component of the Size property to zero.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlLine.InvertY
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value which determines whether the y-axis of the line is inverted.

remarks.p: The origin for a line is always implied to be the top-left corner of it bounding rectangle. When the bounding rectangle's height is non-zero, the slope of the line is negative (resembles a backslash). Setting the InvertY property switches the orientation of the y-axis, making the slope of the line positive.
In the case where either the width or height component of the Size is zero, this property has no effect.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlLine.Type
member.summary: Returns a ShapeType constant which describes the type of the shape.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlLine.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties of this instance to their respective defaults.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlRotatableShape
member.summary: Base class for shapes that support rotational transformation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlRotatableShape.FillColor
member.summary: Returns or sets the color used to fill the interior of the shape.

remarks.p: The FillColor property controls the color of the interior region. Use the LineColor property to change the color of the perimeter of the shape.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlRotatableShape.Rotation
member.summary: Returns or sets the rotation for the shape, expressed in degrees.

remarks.p: Use positive values between 1 and 180 for clockwise rotation about the x-axis.
Use negative values between -1 and -180 for counter-clockwise rotation about the x-axis.
Rotating a shape by exactly 180 degrees is the equivalent of inverting it about the x-axis.

member.summary: Returns a ShapeType constant which describes the type of the shape.

member.summary: Returns a ShapeType constant which describes the type of the shape.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlRightTriangle
member.summary: Renders a right triangle whose apex is at the top left of the bounding rectangle, using Vector Markup Language (VML).

remarks.p: The orientation of the triangle can be changed using the InvertX and InvertY properties.
Setting both the InvertX and InvertY properties to true results in no change to the shape's orientation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlRightTriangle.InvertX
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value which determines whether the x-axis of the triangle is inverted.

remarks.p: The apex for a right triangle is always implied to be aligned with the the left edge of the bounding rectangle. To align it with the right edge, set this property to true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.VmlRightTriangle.InvertY
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value which determines whether the y-axis of the line is inverted.

remarks.p: The apex for a right triangle is always implied to point to the top edge of the bounding rectangle. To switch vertical orientation, set the InvertY property to true.

member.summary: Returns a ShapeType constant which describes the type of the shape.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.LineSpacingRule.Auto
member.summary: Specifies that the line spacing is automatically determined by the size of its contents, with no predetermined minimum or maximum size.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.LineSpacingRule.AtLeast
member.summary: Specifies that the height of the line is at least the value specified, but may be expanded to fit its content as needed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.LineSpacingRule.Exact
member.summary: Specifies that the height of the line shall be exactly the value specified, regardless of the size of the contents. The contents are clipped as necessary under this setting.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterException
member.summary: Thrown when an error is encountered by the WordDocumentWriter.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterException.Message
member.summary: Returns the message for the exception.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterException.Reason
member.summary: Returns an enumerated value which identifies the reason for the exception.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterXmlWriterException
member.summary: Thrown when an exception is thrown by the XMLWriter during the course of writing content to the main document part.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterXmlWriterException.Element
member.summary: Returns the fully qualified name of the XML element that was being written at the time the exception was thrown, or null if there is no associated element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterXmlWriterException.Attribute
member.summary: Returns the fully qualified name of the XML attribute that was being written at the time the exception was thrown, or null if there is no associated attribute.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason
member.summary: Constants which identify the reason an exception was thrown by the WordDocumentWriter class.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.None
member.summary: Used for variable initialization.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.DocumentNotOpen
member.summary: A write method was called before the document was opened.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.ParagraphNotOpen
member.summary: An attempt was made to add content such as a text run, hyperlink, or picture when there is currently no open paragraph.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.TableNotOpen
member.summary: An attempt was made to add content such as a row or cell when there is currently no open table.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.ParagraphNotClosed
member.summary: A previously opened paragraph was not closed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.ParagraphNotClosedTableStarted
member.summary: A new table was started before all paragraphs were closed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.ParagraphNotClosedTableRowStarted
member.summary: A new table row was started before all paragraphs were closed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.ParagraphNotClosedTableCellStarted
member.summary: A new table cell was started before all paragraphs were closed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.NestedParagraph
member.summary: An attempt was made to start a paragraph when one is already open.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.TableNotClosed
member.summary: A previously opened table was not closed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.NestedTable
member.summary: An attempt was made to start a table when one is already open.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.RowNotOpen
member.summary: An attempt was made to add content to a table row or close a table row when there is currently no open row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.NestedRow
member.summary: An attempt was made to add a table row when one is already open in the same table.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.RowNotClosed
member.summary: A table row was opened, but was not properly closed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.RowClosedNoCell
member.summary: An attempt was made to close a table row that has no table cells.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.CellNotClosed
member.summary: A table cell was opened, but was not properly closed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.CellNotClosedTableClosed
member.summary: A table was closed, but closure of a previously opened table cell is pending.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.RowNotClosedTableClosed
member.summary: A table was closed, but closure of a previously opened table row is pending.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.NestedCell
member.summary: An attempt was made to add a table cell when one is already open in the same table.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.CellNotOpen
member.summary: An attempt was made to close a table cell when there is currently no open cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.WriterError
member.summary: The XML writer used to serialize the content is in an error state.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.HeaderWriterError
member.summary: An exception was thrown during the course of writing content to a header section part. The inner exception contains more specific information about the error.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.FooterWriterError
member.summary: An exception was thrown during the course of writing content to a footer section part. The inner exception contains more specific information about the error.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.DocumentClosureError
member.summary: An exception was thrown during the course of closing a document. The inner exception contains more specific information about the error.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.HeaderFooterWriterClosureError
member.summary: An exception was thrown during the course of closing a header or footer writer. The inner exception contains more specific information about the error.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.HeaderFooterWriterNotClosed
member.summary: The document writer was closed, but closure of a header/footer writer is still pending.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.HeaderFooterWriterNotOpened
member.summary: The document writer was closed, but a header/footer writer that was previously created was never opened.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.ParagraphNotClosedSectionStarted
member.summary: A new section was started before all paragraphs were closed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.TableOpenSectionStarted
member.summary: An attempt was made to define a section when a table was open.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.RowOpenSectionStarted
member.summary: An attempt was made to define a section when a table row was open.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriterExceptionReason.CellOpenSectionStarted
member.summary: An attempt was made to define a section when a table cell was open.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font
member.summary: Provides a way to customize the visual attributes of a character or range of characters.

remarks.p: The Font class exposes properties like Bold, Italic, Underline, etc., which enable the developer to format characters in the same manner as a user of MS Word.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.SizeMaxValueTwips
member.summary: The maximum allowable value for the Size property, expressed in twips (32760)

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.Bold
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether the font is bolded.

remarks.p: When not explicitly set, the actual value of the property is determined at a higher level of the property resolution hierarchy.
This property can be restored to its default value by setting it to null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.CharacterSpacing
member.summary: Returns a FontCharacterSpacing instance which provides a way to customize spacing and kerning for a Font

remarks.p: To reduce the memory footprint, creation of the FontCharacterSpacing object returned from this property is deferred until it is requested publicly by a consumer. To avoid triggering creation, use the HasCharacterSpacing property before accessing this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.HasCharacterSpacing
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the FontCharacterSpacing instance returned from the CharacterSpacing property has been created.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.ForeColor
member.summary: Returns or sets the color of the text.

remarks.p: The default color value can be reinstated by setting this property to Color.Empty.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.BackColor
member.summary: Returns or sets the background color that is applied to the area behind the text.

remarks.p: The default color value can be reinstated by setting this property to Color.Empty.
By default, no color is applied to the area behind the text. Use this property to fill the rectangle which encloses the text area with a particular color, i.e., to "highlight" the text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.Effects
member.summary: Returns a FontEffects instance which provides extended formatting functionality for the font.

remarks.p: To reduce the memory footprint, creation of the FontEffects object returned from this property is deferred until it is requested publicly by a consumer. To avoid triggering creation, use the HasEffects property before accessing this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.HasEffects
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the FontEffects instance returned from the Effects property has been created.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.Italic
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether the font is italicized.

remarks.p: When not explicitly set, the actual value of the property is determined at a higher level of the property resolution hierarchy.
This property can be restored to its default value by setting it to null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.Name
member.summary: Returns or sets the name of the font.

remarks.p: When not explicitly set, the actual value of the property is determined at a higher level of the property resolution hierarchy.
This property can be restored to its default value by setting it to null or an empty string.

ASCII characters within the range of 0 through 127 are displayed with the font associated with the value of this property. Other fonts can be designated for use with character sets outside the standard ASCII range using the following properties:
NameComplexScript
NameEastAsia
NameHighAnsi

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.NameComplexScript
member.summary: Returns or sets the font which is used to format all characters in a complex script Unicode range within the associated run.

remarks.p: If this property is not explicitly set, the text is displayed in a default font which supports complex script content.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.NameEastAsia
member.summary: Returns or sets the font which is used to format all characters in an East Asian Unicode range within the associated run.

remarks.p: If this property is not explicitly set, the text is displayed in a default font which supports East Asian content.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.NameHighAnsi
member.summary: Returns or sets the font which is used to format all characters in a Unicode range within the associated run which does not fall into any of the categories defined by the Name, NameComplexScript, or NameEastAsia properties.

remarks.p: If this property is not explicitly set, the text is displayed in a default font which supports high ANSI content.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.Size
member.summary: Returns or sets the size at which the font is displayed.

remarks.p: The value assigned to this property must be a value between the range of 1 and 1638 DTPs (desktop publishing points), inclusive.
The unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property of the associated WordDocumentWriter.
This property can be restored to its default value by setting it to null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.Underline
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating the manner in which the font is underlined.

remarks.p: When not explicitly set, the actual value of the property is determined at a higher level of the property resolution hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.UnderlineColor
member.summary: Returns or sets the color of the line drawn under the text.

remarks.p: The default underline color value can be reinstated by setting this property to Color.Empty.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.RightToLeft
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the reading order for the associated run of text.

remarks.p: This setting determines the manner in which the run contents are presented in the document when punctuation characters are part of the run's contents. When this property is specified, each part of the run between a punctuation mark is laid out in a right-to-left direction on the line.
Typically the developer will also set the RightToLeft property on the ParagraphProperties instance for the paragraph to which this run belongs when using this property.

Setting this property to true will cause the serialization layer to add complex script XML elements for the Bold, Italic, and Size properties to the output document. This behavior can be overridden by explicitly setting the UseComplexScript property to false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Font.UseComplexScript
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines whether the contents of this run shall be treated as complex script text regardless of the Unicode character values contained therein when determining the formatting for this run.

remarks.p: WordprocessingML uses different XML elements to express the bold, italic, and size attributes of the font for standard and complex scripts. When the NameComplexScript property is explicitly set, the complex scripts elements are automatically added.

This property causes the text contained within the associated run to be treated as complex script, effectively resolving any ambiguities that may arise by virtue of the bold, italic, or size attributes being set for both standard and complex scripts.

member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating the size at which kerning algorithms are applied to the font.

remarks.p: The value assigned to this property must be a value between the range of 1 and 1638 DTPs (desktop publishing points), inclusive.
The unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property of the associated WordDocumentWriter.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.FontCharacterSpacing.Scaling
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating the horizontal scaling percentage for the associated font.

remarks.p: The value assigned to this property must be between the range of 1 and 600, inclusive.

This property represents the percentage of scaling, with a value of 100 representing the default scaling for the font. Values less than 100 cause the font to be horizontally compressed; Values greater than 100 cause the font to be horizontally elongated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.FontCharacterSpacing.Spacing
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating the amount of horizontal spacing between characters for the associated font.

remarks.p: The value assigned to this property must be a value between the range of -1584 and +1584 DTPs (desktop publishing points), inclusive.
This property represents the amount of space that appears between horizontally adjacent characters.
The unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property of the associated WordDocumentWriter.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.FontCharacterSpacing.Position
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating the amount by which the text is vertically offset from the baseline for the associated font.

remarks.p: The value assigned to this property must be a value between the range of -1584 and +1584 DTPs (desktop publishing points), inclusive. A value of zero restores the position to normal as relative to the baseline.

This property represents the amount of vertical space between the bottom of the character and the baseline for the associated font. Positive values cause characters to appear higher than characters whose position is normal as relative to the baseline; negative values cause characters to appear lower.
The unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property of the associated WordDocumentWriter.

member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the amount of spacing that appears above the paragraph.

remarks.p: The unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property of the associated WordDocumentWriter.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphProperties.SpacingAfter
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the amount of spacing that appears after the last line of the associated paragraph.

remarks.p: The unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property of the associated WordDocumentWriter.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphProperties.LineSpacingExact
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the exact amount of vertical spacing that appears between lines of text in the associated paragraph.

remarks.p: The LineSpacingExact, LineSpacingMinimum, and LineSpacingAuto properties are mutually exclusive; when one property is set, the others are not applicable.

In the case where more than one of the properties is explicitly set, the order of precedence is as follows:
LineSpacingExact
LineSpacingMinimum
LineSpacingAuto
The unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property of the associated WordDocumentWriter.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphProperties.LineSpacingMinimum
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the minimum amount of vertical spacing that appears between lines of text in the associated paragraph. Applicable only when the LineSpacingExact property is not explicitly set.

remarks.p: The LineSpacingExact, The LineSpacingMinimum, and LineSpacingAuto properties are mutually exclusive; when one property is set, the others are not applicable.

In the case where more than one of the properties is explicitly set, the order of precedence is as follows:
LineSpacingExact
LineSpacingMinimum
LineSpacingAuto
The unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property of the associated WordDocumentWriter.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphProperties.LineSpacingAuto
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the amount of vertical spacing that appears between lines of text in the associated paragraph, expressed as a multiple of the line height for the paragraph. Applicable only when the LineSpacingExact and LineSpacingMinimum properties are not explicitly set.

remarks.p: The LineSpacingAuto property provides a way for the developer to space lines such that the actual value is automatically calculated by the document consumer based on the line height for the associated paragraph. An explicit value can be specified for line spacing using the LineSpacingExact property.
The LineSpacingExact , LineSpacingMinimum and LineSpacingAuto properties are mutually exclusive; when one property is set, the others are not applicable.

In the case where more than one of the properties is explicitly set, the order of precedence is as follows:
LineSpacingExact
LineSpacingMinimum
LineSpacingAuto

Unlike the LineSpacingExact and LineSpacingMinimum properties, this property's value is always expressed as a multiple of the line height for the paragraph, and is never converted based on the value of the associated WordDocumentWriter's Unit property.

For example, to apply vertical spacing between lines of text that is equal to .5 times the height of the line itself, assign a value of .5 to the LineSpacingAuto property, and leave the values of the LineSpacingExact and LineSpacingMinimum properties at their respective defaults.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphProperties.PageBreakBefore
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines whether a page break is inserted before the associated paragraph.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphProperties.RightToLeft
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines whether the paragraph is presented in a right-to-left direction.

remarks.p: This property only applies to paragraph-level properties, and does not affect the layout of the text within. Setting this property to true has an effect similar to that of setting the Alignment property to 'Right'.
To change the layout of the text within the paragraph, use the RightToLeft property of the Font class.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphProperties.BulletLevel
member.summary: Returns or sets a BulletLevelProperties instance which displays the associated paragraph as a bullet point or with automatic numbering.

remarks.p: Use this property to designate this paragraph as a bullet point, or to enable automatic numbering.
A BulletProperties instance is created by calling the CreateBulletProperties method.

A BulletLevelProperties instance is obtained via the Levels collection of the BulletProperties instance. Simply reference the desired level using the indexer, which takes an integer representing the zero-based level to be returned.
That BulletLevelProperties instance can be referenced by any number of paragraphs by assigning a reference to that instance to this property.

member.summary: Returns a unique identifier which differentiates this instance from any others that were created for the associated WordDocumentWriter.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.BulletProperties.Levels
member.summary: Returns a collection which contains a BulletLevelProperties instance for each bullet/automatic numbering level.

remarks.p: Note that a maximum number of nine (9) levels is supported for both bullet lists and automatic numbering runs.

Note that the indexer for this collection supports lazy creation, i.e., it is not necessary to add members to the underlying collection. If the referenced instance has not yet been created, accessing it through this property will trigger creation. If the specified level references an instance which has already been created, that reference is returned.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.BulletProperties.BulletLevelPropertiesCollection
member.summary: Collection class which contains instances of BulletLevelProperties instances.

remarks.p: Note that the maximum number of supported levels for a bullet list or automatic numbering run is nine (9).

Note that the indexer for this collection supports lazy creation, i.e., it is not necessary to add members to the underlying collection. If the referenced instance has not yet been created, accessing it through the indexer will trigger creation. If the specified level references an instance which has already been created, that reference is returned. This precludes the need for an Add method.

member.summary: Returns the unique identifier of the associated BulletProperties instance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.BulletLevelProperties.Level
member.summary: Returns the bullet level at which the associated paragraph appears.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.BulletLevelProperties.NumberingStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets the numbering style applied to paragraphs at this bullet/numbering level.

remarks.p: The value of this property defaults to 'None', which causes a bullet point to be displayed instead of a number.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.BulletLevelProperties.BulletText
member.summary: Returns or sets the character or characters which depict the bullet point.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable when the NumberingStyle property is set to 'None'. In all other cases, the string which appears in the serialized XML to indicate automatic numbering is returned.

Typically the value assigned to this property consists of a symbol character. The appearance of this character in the document is determined by the way that character appears under the font settings defined by the Font property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.BulletLevelProperties.Start
member.summary: Returns or sets the number at which an automatic numbering run begins.

remarks.p: This property is not applicable when the NumberingStyle property is set to 'Bullet'.
To begin a numbering run at an arbitrary number, set this property to that number.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.BulletLevelProperties.Indent
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the indentation from the left or right margin for the associated paragraph.

remarks.p: The unit of measure to which this value applies is determined by the value of the associated WordDocumentWriter's Unit property.
The margin to which this value is relative is determined by the document layout.
For right-to-left reading languages, this value is relative to the right margin; in all other cases it is relative to the left margin.
Whether the associated paragraph is formatted for a right-to-left reading language is determined by the RightToLeft property.

In the absence of an explicit setting, this property resolves to a value that equals one-half inch multiplied by a number that is one greater than the level number. For example, at the third indentation level (Level property equaling two since it is zero-based), the resolved value is (.5" X 2) = 1".

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.BulletLevelProperties.Font
member.summary: Returns the font used for the associated bullet point or automatic numbering.

remarks.p: In the case where the NumberingStyle property is set to 'None', i.e., a bullet point is displayed, the symbol used for the bullet point is determined by the value of the BulletText property, as it appears under this font setting.
When configured for automatic numbering, this property determines the font applied to the number(s) or letter(s) displayed to depict the automatic numbering value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.BulletLevelProperties.HasFont
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether a font has been explicitly created, and has had a value assigned to at least one of its name properties.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.BulletLevelProperties.ResetFont
member.summary: Restores the Font property to its default value.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionProperties
member.summary: Provides a way to control page attributes such as size, margins, and orientation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionProperties.PageSize
member.summary: Returns or sets the size for all pages in the associated section.

remarks.p: When set explicitly, the unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property.

When the PageOrientation property is left at its default setting, the PageSize property defines the effective orientation. In cases where the width is greater than the height, the PageOrientation property resolves to 'Landscape'.

In the absence of an explicit setting, this property resolves to a value that is equal to 8.5 inches in width by 11 inches in height, or, if the PageOrientation property is explicitly set to 'Landscape', 11" x 8.5".
The maximum page size in MS Word is 22" x 22" (see KB article 95109). An exception is thrown if the specified value is outside this range.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionProperties.PageMargins
member.summary: Returns or sets the margins for all pages in the associated section.

remarks.p: In the absence of an explicit setting, this property resolves to a value that is equal to one inch on all sides.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionProperties.HeaderMargin
member.summary: Returns or sets the distance between the top edge of the page and the top edge of the header.

remarks.p: When set explicitly, the unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property.
In the absence of an explicit setting, this property resolves to .5".

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionProperties.FooterMargin
member.summary: Returns or sets the distance between the top edge of the page and the top edge of the footer.

remarks.p: When set explicitly, the unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property.
In the absence of an explicit setting, this property resolves to .5".

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionProperties.PaperCode
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which represents a printer-specific paper code for the paper type for all pages in the associated section.

remarks.p: This property is used to ensure that the proper paper type is chosen if the specified paper size matches the sizes of multiple paper types supported by the current printer. How this value is consumed is dependent solely on the printer, and is not interpreted or modified in any way by this class.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionProperties.PageOrientation
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which defines the orientation for all pages in the associated section.

remarks.p: Under the default setting, the actual value is resolved based on the ratio of the width to the height of the page size. If the width is greater than the height, this property resolves to 'Landscape', otherwise it resolves to 'Portrait'.

When the PageOrientation property is explicitly set, the value of the PageSize property is adjusted if necessary so that the ratio of width to height is in agreement with the page orientation. For example, if the page size is explicitly set to have a width of five inches and a height of seven, and PageOrientation is explicitly set to 'Landscape', the page size is inverted so as not to contradict the orientation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionProperties.StartingPageNumber
member.summary: Returns or sets the page number for the first page in this section.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable when a header/footer is defined for the section. Headers/footers can be created using the AddSectionHeaderFooter method.
Page numbers can be specified for a header or footer using the AddPageNumberField method.
When no value is specified for this property, page numbers continue from the previous section.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionProperties.Create(Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriter)
member.summary: Returns a new instance which is associated with the specified WordDocumentWriter.
member.param: The associated WordDocumentWriter instance.
member.returns: A new SectionProperties instance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionProperties.Reset
member.summary: Restores all property values for this instance to their respective defaults.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphAlignment
member.summary: Constants which specify the alignment for a paragraph or table.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphAlignment.Both
member.summary: Specifies that the text is justified between both of the text margins in the document.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that the text is centered on the line between both of the text margins in the document.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphAlignment.Distribute
member.summary: Specifies that the text is justified between both of the text margins in the document.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphAlignment.HighKashida
member.summary: Specifies that the kashida length for text in the current paragraph is extended to its widest possible length. Note: This setting only affects kashidas, which are special characters used to extend the joiner between two Arabic characters.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphAlignment.Left
member.summary: Specifies that the text is aligned on the left text margin in the document.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphAlignment.LowKashida
member.summary: Specifies that the kashida length for text in the current paragraph is extended to a slightly longer length. Note: This setting only affects kashidas, which are special characters used to extend the joiner between two Arabic characters.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphAlignment.MediumKashida
member.summary: Specifies that the kashida length for text in the current paragraph is extended to a medium length determined by the consumer. Note: This setting only affects kashidas, which are special characters used to extend the joiner between two Arabic characters.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphAlignment.NumTab
member.summary: Specifies that the text is aligned to the list tab, which is the tab stop after the numbering for the current paragraph.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphAlignment.Right
member.summary: Specifies that the text is aligned on the right text margin in the document.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ParagraphAlignment.ThaiDistribute
member.summary: Specifies that the text is justified with an optimization for Thai. Note: This type of justification affects both the interword spacing on each line and the inter-character spacing between each word when justifying its contents, unlike the 'Both' setting. This difference is created in that the inter-character space is increased slightly in order to ensure that the additional space created by the justification is reduced.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.UnitOfMeasurement
member.summary: Constants which specify the implied unit of measurement for properties which represent a graphical length.

remarks.p: The default unit of measurement is a desktop publishing point, which is equal to 1/72 of an inch.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.UnitOfMeasurement.Point
member.summary: Units are expressed as DTPs (desktop publishing points), a unit equal to 1/72 of an inch. One point is equal to 20 twips.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.UnitOfMeasurement.Twip
member.summary: Units are expressed as one-twentieths of a point, or 1/1440 of an inch.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.UnitOfMeasurement.Inch
member.summary: Units are expressed as inches (U.S. customary units). One inch is equal to 1,440 twips.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.UnitOfMeasurement.Centimeter
member.summary: Units are expressed as centimeters. One centimeter is equal to approximately 567 twips.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellVerticalMerge
member.summary: Constants which describe the manner in which a TableCell is vertically merged with adjacent cells.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellVerticalMerge.None
member.summary: No vertical merging. The cell appears to span only the row to which it belongs.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellVerticalMerge.Start
member.summary: Begins a vertical merging run. If the associated cell follows one which belongs to a vertical merging run, that run is discontinued. If no cells 'above' the associated cell belong to a vertical merging run, a new run begins.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellVerticalMerge.Continue
member.summary: Continues a previously defined vertical merging run. If no cells 'above' the associated cell belong to a vertical merging run, this setting has no effect.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.RowHeightRule
member.summary: Constants which describe the rule applied when calculating the height of a table row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.RowHeightRule.Auto
member.summary: Specifies that the height of the row is automatically determined by the size of its contents, with no predetermined minimum or maximum size.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.RowHeightRule.AtLeast
member.summary: Specifies that the height of the row is at least the value specified, but may be expanded to fit its content as needed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.RowHeightRule.Exact
member.summary: Specifies that the height of the row is exactly the value specified, regardless of the size of its contents. If the content is too large for the specified height, it is clipped.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellTextDirection
member.summary: Constants which describe the direction of text flow for table cells.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellTextDirection.Normal
member.summary: Text flows normally, from left to right along the x-axis.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellTextDirection.BottomToTopLeftToRight
member.summary: Specifies that text flows from bottom to top vertically, then from left to right horizontally on the page. Under this setting, vertical lines are filled before the text expands horizontally.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellTextDirection.LeftToRightTopToBottom
member.summary: Specifies that text flows from left to right horizontally, then top to bottom vertically on the page. Under this setting, horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellTextDirection.LeftToRightTopToBottomRotated
member.summary: Specifies that text flows from left to right horizontally, then top to bottom vertically on the page. Under this setting, horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically. This flow is also rotated such that any East Asian text shall be rotated 270 degrees when displayed on a page.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellTextDirection.TopToBottomLeftToRightRotated
member.summary: Specifies that text flows from top to bottom vertically, then left to right horizontally on the page. Under this setting, vertical lines are filled before the text expands horizontally. This flow is also rotated such that all text is rotated 90 degrees when displayed on a page.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellTextDirection.TopToBottomRightToLeft
member.summary: Specifies that text flows from right to left horizontally, then top to bottom vertically on the page. Under this setting, vertical lines are filled before the text expands horizontally.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellTextDirection.TopToBottomRightToLeftRotated
member.summary: Specifies that text flows from right to left horizontally, then top to bottom vertically on the page. Under this setting, vertical lines are filled before the text expands horizontal. This flow is also rotated such that all text is rotated 90 degrees when displayed on a page.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableLayout
member.summary: Constants which define the possible types of layout algorithms which are applied when determining the size and position of table cells.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableLayout.Auto
member.summary: The preferred widths of the table items are used to generate the final sizing of the table, but the contents of each cell determines the final column widths.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableLayout.Fixed
member.summary: The preferred widths of the table items are used to generate the final sizing of the table, but does not change that size, regardless of the contents of each cell.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.PageOrientation
member.summary: Constants which define the orientation for a page in the document.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.PageOrientation.Default
member.summary: The actual value is determined by the page size. If the width of the page size is greater than the height, the orientation resolves to 'Landscape'; if the width is equal or less than the height, it resolves to 'Portrait'.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.PageOrientation.Portrait
member.summary: Pages in the associated section are printed in portrait mode, with no rotation. The page size is adjusted, if necessary, so that the height is greater than or equal to the width, by swapping the values as defined by the page size.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.PageOrientation.Landscape
member.summary: Pages in the associated section are printed at a 90 degree rotation with respect to the normal page orientation. The page size is adjusted, if necessary, so that the width is greater than or equal to the height, by swapping the values as defined by the page size.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionHeaderFooterParts
member.summary: Constants which describe the header and footer parts that will be created in a document section when used by the AddSectionHeaderFooter method.

remarks.p: This enumeration is decorated with the System.Flags attribute, which means that the constants defined herein can be combined using the logical OR operator. For example, to specify that a document section should contain both a header and a footer, on all pages, the values 'HeaderAllPages' (0x0001) and 'FooterAllPages' (0x0002) would be combined in a bitwise manner to produce a numerical value of 0x0003, resulting in both a header and a footer on all pages in the section.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionHeaderFooterParts.None
member.summary: No headers or footers should appear in the section.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionHeaderFooterParts.HeaderAllPages
member.summary: A header which appears on all pages of the section.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionHeaderFooterParts.FooterAllPages
member.summary: A footer which appears on all pages of the section.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionHeaderFooterParts.HeaderFirstPageOnly
member.summary: A header which appears only on the first page of the section.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionHeaderFooterParts.FooterFirstPageOnly
member.summary: A footer which appears only on the first page of the section.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionHeaderFooterParts.All
member.summary: Combines the HeaderAllPages, FooterAllPages, HeaderFirstPageOnly, and FooterFirstPageOnly settings.

member.summary: Specifies that this header/footer is to appear on every page in this section which is not overridden with a specific first page header/footer.

member.summary: Specifies that this header/footer is to appear on only the first page of the section.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ShapeType
member.summary: Constants which define the types of shapes that can appear within a document.

remarks.p: The WordDocumentWriter currently only supports shape rendering using Vector Markup Language (VML); the reason this rendering mode is used is that it is supported in both MS Word 2007 and MS Word 2010.
The following table lists the classnames of the VML shapes associated with each constant:

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ShapeType.Line
member.summary: A straight line. The origin of the line is implied to be at the top left corner of the rectangle defined by its position within the document and its size, and its endpoint is implied to be the bottom right corner of that rectangle. For lines that run parallel to the x or y axis, the width or height component of the Size property is set to zero (pure horizontal lines have a height of zero, pure vertical lines have a width of zero). A line can be inverted about the x axis using the InvertY property. This is used to render a line with a positive slope; since the origin is implied to be the top left corner of the bounding rect, the origin must be transformed to the bottom left corner.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ShapeType.Rectangle
member.summary: A rectangle. The bounds of the rectangle are defined by its position within the document and its size.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ShapeType.Ellipse
member.summary: An ellipse. The bounds of the enclosing rectangle are defined by its position within the document and its size.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ShapeType.IsosceleseTriangle
member.summary: A triangle whose apex is at the center of the rectangle which encloses it. The bounds of the enclosing rectangle are defined by its position within the document and its size.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ShapeType.RightTriangle
member.summary: A triangle whose apex is at the left edge of the rectangle which encloses it. The bounds of the enclosing rectangle are defined by its position within the document and its size.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.NewLineType
member.summary: Constants which specify the way a newline within a paragraph is represented in the generated output.

remarks.p: A document consumer may interpret the behavior of line breaking characters differently depending on the characters used to represent them. For example, MS Word interprets a carriage return differently depending on whether the content is enclosed within a table cell. Paragraph justification also behaves differently depending on whether a line break or carriage return is used.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.NewLineType.LineBreak
member.summary:
The newline is represented as a line break. For the WordprocessingML format, the '
' tag is used to represent the newline in the generated XML.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Word.NewLineType.CarriageReturn
member.summary: The newline is represented as a carriage return. For the WordprocessingML format, the '<cr>' tag is used to represent the newline in the generated XML.

member.summary: Restores all property values for this instance to their respective defaults.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellProperties
member.summary: Encapsulates the properties of a table cell.

remarks.p: This class is used to override the table-level cell properties for a cell or group of cells. One instance can be used to define the properties of multiple cells.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellProperties.BorderProperties
member.summary: Returns or sets an object which provides a way to customize the borders for the associated cell.

remarks.p: Cell border properties are inherited from the table to which the cell belongs. This property provides a way to interrupt inheritance of table borders for a cell or group of cells.

The instance returned from this property's get method will be created when it is first requested, i.e., "lazily". A previously created instance can be assigned (for example, from a previously created TableCellProperties instance), provided that they are associated with the same WordDocumentWriter. This approach can reduce the heap fragmentation that can result from excessive object instantiation in the case where the border properties must be explicitly set for a relatively large number of cells.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellProperties.HasBorderProperties
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether an object has been created for or assigned to the BorderProperties property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellProperties.ColumnSpan
member.summary: Returns or sets an integral value which determines the number of columns across which this cell spans.

remarks.p: By default, a cell spans across only one column, typically having the same PreferredWidth as that column. The ColumnSpan property makes it possible to support horizontal cell merging, whereby one cell can appear to span across two or more columns. For example, consider a grid with 3 columns, A, B, and C. If the developer wants the cell in position A to extend to the left edge of cell C, effectively skipping cell B, the ColumnSpan property of cell A would be set to 2.

In addition to setting the ColumnSpan property, the PreferredWidth property must also be set to an appropriate value in order to make a cell span across multiple columns. Using the example above, the PreferredWidth of cell A must be set to (A.PreferredWidth + B.PreferredWidth) in order to make it span to the left edge of cell C.
The default value of zero logically represents a span of one column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellProperties.TextDirection
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating the direction of text flow for text within the associated table cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellProperties.VerticalMerge
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating whether this cell should begin or continue a vertical merging run with adjacent cells.

remarks.p: Similarly to how the ColumnSpan property supports horizontal cell merging, the VerticalMerge property can be used to start a vertical merging run, or continue an existing one.

When set to 'Start', a vertical merging run begins with this cell. Subsequent cells whose VerticalMerge property is set to 'Continue' will appear to merge with the cell directly above in the same column. When set to 'None', any existing vertical merging run is interrupted. The 'Start' setting also discontinues any existing vertical merging run.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellProperties.PreferredWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets the preferred width of the associated table cell, expressed as an explicit linear quantity.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable when the Layout property is set to 'Auto'.

The PreferredWidth property provides a way to explicitly define the width of the associated table cell. The value is considered preferred because the actual width may be different based on the current table layout algorithm.
The unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property of the associated WordDocumentWriter.

The PreferredWidth property and the PreferredWidthAsPercentage properties are mutually exclusive, and the PreferredWidth property takes precedence, so in the case where both properties are explicitly set, the PreferredWidthAsPercentage property is not applicable.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellProperties.PreferredWidthAsPercentage
member.summary: Returns or sets the preferred width of the associated table cell, expressed as a percentage of the width of the containing table.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable when the Layout property is set to 'Fixed'.
This value is considered preferred because a consumer may elect to override this value based on the current table layout algorithm.
The valid range for this property's value is a number between .02 and 100. Note that the unit of measure is not defined by the associated document writer's unit of measure.

The PreferredWidthAsPercentage property and the PreferredWidth properties are mutually exclusive, and the PreferredWidth property takes precedence, so in the case where both properties are explicitly set, the PreferredWidth property takes precedence, and this property is not applicable.

member.returns: A new TableCellProperties instance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableProperties.Layout
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the layout algorithm that is used to determine the size and position of cells in the associated table.

remarks.p: By default, the table layout is automatic, which means that cells are automatically sized to fully display their contents. The Layout property can be used to apply explicit column widths.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableProperties.PreferredWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets the preferred width of the associated table, expressed as an explicit linear quantity.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable when the Layout property is set to 'Fixed'.
The value of this property is considered preferred because a consumer may elect to override this value based on the current table layout algorithm.
The unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property of the associated WordDocumentWriter.

The PreferredWidth property and the PreferredWidthAsPercentage properties are mutually exclusive, and the PreferredWidth property takes precedence, so in the case where both properties are explicitly set, the PreferredWidthAsPercentage property is not applicable.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableProperties.PreferredWidthAsPercentage
member.summary: Returns or sets the preferred width of the associated table, expressed as a percentage of the width of the containing element.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable when the Layout property is set to 'Fixed'.
This value is considered preferred because a consumer may elect to override this value based on the current table layout algorithm.
The valid range for this property's value is a number between .02 and 100. Note that the unit of measure is not defined by the associated document writer's unit of measure.

The PreferredWidthAsPercentage property and the PreferredWidth properties are mutually exclusive, and the PreferredWidth property takes precedence, so in the case where both properties are explicitly set, the PreferredWidth property takes precedence, and this property is not applicable.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableBorderProperties
member.summary: Encapsulates the properties of the borders applied to tables and cells.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableBorderProperties.Sides
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which defines whether the top, left, right, and bottom borders are drawn for a table or cell.

remarks.p: All borders are drawn for all cells in a table by default; however, in cases where the border style does not preclude it, the borders of adjacent cells are merged, so as not to cause the borders to appear "thicker" than the user would expect. Because of these border merging algorithms, setting this property may not yield the expected result.
Note that the value of this property takes precedence over the VerticalMerge and ColumnSpan properties with regard to border drawing.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableBorderProperties.Style
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the style of the borders.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableBorderProperties.Color
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the color of the borders.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableBorderProperties.Width
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the width of the borders.

remarks.p: WordprocessingML persists border widths in units equal to one-eighth of a desktop publishing point; this equates to 1/576 of an inch. The range of valid values spans from one-fourth of a point to 12 points.
A value which is based on a specific number of pixels can be assigned using the SetWidthInPixels method.
WordprocessingML supports border thicknesses up to one-sixth of an inch. Values which exceed this amount are not recognized, and the resulting border thickness resolves to this value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableBorderProperties.SetWidthInPixels(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Assigns a value to the Width property that is equals to the specified number of pixels at the specified resolution.
member.param: The border's width, expressed as an integral number of pixels.
The pixel resolution, expressed as the number of pixels required to span one inch.

remarks.p: Values less than zero are not permitted for either parameter; an exception is thrown when a negative value is assigned. Values that would exceed the minimum or maximum allowable value are rounded to the min/max as required.

member.summary: Encapsulates the properties of a table row.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRowProperties.CellsBefore
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the number of logical grid units that are skipped before the first cell in this row is displayed.

remarks.p: By default, the first cell of the row is displayed in the first logical grid position. This property can be used to "offset" the beginning of the row; this can be useful in situations where the row should appear indented with respect to other rows in the same table.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRowProperties.CellsAfter
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the number of logical grid units that are left after the last cell in this row is displayed.

remarks.p: By default, the last cell of the row is displayed in the last logical grid position. This property can be used to omit one or more cells from the end of the row.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRowProperties.CellSpacing
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the amount of spacing applied between adjacent cells and the table borders.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRowProperties.Height
member.summary: Returns or sets the height of the associated row.

remarks.p: The unit of measure is determined by the value of the Unit property.
When a value is explicitly assigned to the Height property, but not to the HeightRule property, the HeightRule resolves to 'Exact'.
When the HeightRule property is set to 'Auto', the value of the Height property is not applicable.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRowProperties.HeightRule
member.summary: Returns or sets the rule applied when calculating the Height of the associated row.

remarks.p: By default, the row height rule is 'Auto', unless a value is explicitly assigned to the Height property, in which case it defaults to 'Exact'. Explicitly assigning a value to the HeightRule property overrides this behavior.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRowProperties.IsHeaderRow
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether the associated row is repeated at the top of each page on which it appears.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRowProperties.AllowPageBreak
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether the associated row can span across multiple pages.

remarks.p: In the case where this property is not explicitly set, rows are allowed to span multiple pages. This property can be explicitly set to false to ensure that the associated row is not displayed on more than one page.

member.summary: Defines the properties of the document such as Title, Author, Manager, etc.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriter.DefaultParagraphProperties
member.summary: Defines the default formatting for paragraphs which have no more specific formatting attributes defined.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriter.FinalSectionProperties
member.summary: Defines the page-related properties of the document such as size, margins, and orientation. Applies to all content in the document which follows the last explicitly defined section.

remarks.p: This property defines the pagination for all content within the document which is not explicitly associated with a section defined via the DefineSection method. Sections defined by that method apply to all content that was written prior to the method call; from this it follows that once the DefineSection method is called, pagination is then explicitly defined for all previously written content in the document. As such, the pagination as defined by this property applies to the content that was written after the last call to DefineSection, or to the "final" section of the document.
In the case where the DefineSection method is not used, this property defines the pagination for the entire document.
Headers and/or footers can be defined for the final section using the AddHeaderFooterSection method.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriter.DefaultTableProperties
member.summary: Defines the default formatting for tables which have no more specific formatting attributes defined.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriter.DefaultFont
member.summary: Returns the font that determines the formatting for all text runs which do not have more specific formatting attributes defined.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriter.Unit
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating the implied unit of measurement for properties which represent graphical quantities.

remarks.p: The default unit of measurement for the properties which represent graphical quantities is the desktop publishing point, which is equivalent to 1/72 of an inch. This property can be changed to redefine that unit of measurement, so that graphical properties can be interacted with using units that are most comfortable to the end developer.

All property values are stored internally as twips (twentieths of a point), and coverted as appropriate in the property's get and set method implementations. The value of the Unit property can be changed at any time by the developer without affecting previously persisted property values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriter.WriterState
member.summary: Returns a bitflag value which describes the current state of the writer.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriter.NewLineType
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the method used to represent a newline in the generated output.

remarks.p: The newline character(s) can be represented as either a line break or a carriage return. A document consumer may interpret a line break or carriage return differently depending on the circumstances under which it is used. For example, paragraph justification can behave differently in MS Word depending on whether a line break is contained within the paragraph. A carriage return is recognized in a standard paragraph as a line-breaking character, but is not recognized when the paragraph is contained within a table cell.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriter.AddNewLine
member.summary: Adds a text run consisting of the newline character to the current paragraph.

remarks.p: The actual character code(s) used in the generated content are determined by the NewLineType property.
Before the AddNewLine method can be called, the developer must begin a paragraph via the StartParagraph method, or an exception is thrown.

Some consumers do not always recognize newline characters within the content. For example, MS Word does not escape the current line when the paragraph appears within a table cell. The AddEmptyParagraph method can be used as an alternative to this method, although this requires closing the current paragraph prior to calling the method.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.WordDocumentWriter.DefineSection(Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionProperties)
member.summary: Creates a section in the document, which defines the pagination for paragraphs and tables that were written since the last section was created.
member.param: A SectionProperties instance which defines properties such as page size, margins, and orientation. An new instance of this class can be obtained by calling the CreateSectionProperties method.

remarks.p: WordprocessingML does not natively store the concept of pages, since the number of pages in a document is driven by the nature of the content. Consider the case where the user changes the size of the font for all text in a document; the number of pages in that document is likely to change, since factors such as the number of characters in the document and the size of each character determine the total amount of space required to present the content.

This method defines a section which applies to content (i.e., paragraphs and tables) that was previously written to the document. The properties of the object passed to this method define the page size, orientation, and margins for the pages on which that content will appear, thus defining a section in the document to which the designated content belongs.

Example: To add three paragraphs which are to appear on pages that are 7" x 5" at landscape orientation, first call the StartDocument, AddTextRun, and EndDocument methods for each of the three paragraphs. Next, call the DefineSection method, passing in a SectionProperties instance on which the PageSize property is set to (7, 5), and the PageOrientation property is set to 'Landscape'.
The FinalSectionProperties property can be used to define the pagination for all content which is not associated with any section defined by this method.
